text: Treatment with FP ex vivo demonstrated a concentration - dependent decrease in the direct interaction between phospho - <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and importin-alpha in PBMCs from patients with asthma ( Figure 6A and 6B ) , which was significantly inhibited at 10-12 M FP ( p < 0.001 , ANOVA and Newman-Keuls test ) and completely attenuated by 10-8 M FP ( p < 0.001 , ANOVA and Newman-Keuls test ) .

text: This concentration is close to peak plasma levels obtained from asthmatic patients treated with inhaled FP ( 500 microg ) [ 27 ] .

Inhaled FP ( 500 microg ) treatment of seven steroid-naive asthma patients significantly reduced <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - importin-alpha interaction in vivo in a time - dependent manner .

text: This produced a > 90 % decrease in <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - importin-alpha association at 2 h ( median [ 95 % CI ] , 13 , 494 [ 6 , 828-17 , 829 ] versus 879 [ 597-1 , 165 ] ; p < 0.05 Friedman 's analysis ) .

text: However , this did not reach significance using Wilcoxon 's post-test analysis ( W = 6.00 ) probably due to low numbers of participants .
Similar results were observed when <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - importin-alpha association was measured ( Figure 6C and 6D ) .
The lower dose of FP ( 100 microg ) was not effective .

The attenuated interaction of <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> did not result from the defective recycling of importin-alpha , as a significant decrease in the abundance of importin-alpha in the cytoplasmic pool was not detected ( Figure 6E ) .

text: We further examined whether inhaled FP could affect cellular localization of <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in peripheral blood T cells .

text: Treatment with inhaled FP ( 500 microg ) for 2 h significantly increased <extra_id_0> GR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> nuclear translocation ( Figure 7A ) and concomitantly decreased the number of nuclear <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoreactive peripheral blood T cells ( 37 % + / -4.2 % versus 58.2 % + / -4.95 % , p = 0.016 , W = 28.0 , Wilcoxon 's rank test ) compared with placebo as measured by immunocytochemistry ( Figure 7A and 7B ) .

text: This was confirmed by Western blotting , which also indicated that this effect was both time - and dose - dependent ( Figure 7C and 7D ) .

Thus , inhaled FP ( 500 microg ) induced significant loss in nuclear <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at 2 h ( median [ 95 % CI ] , 0.40 [ 0.27-0.53 ] versus 0.14 [ 0.11-0.19 ] , p < 0.05 , W = 21.00 , Wilcoxon 's rank test ) ( Figure 7C ) and cytoplasmic <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels were enhanced by inhaled FP in a dose - dependent manner ( median [ 95 % CI ] , 0.0032 [ 0.0026-0.0039 ] versus 0.658 [ 0.592-0.720 ] , p < 0.05 , W = -21.00 , Wilcoxon 's rank test ) ( Figure 7D ) .

text: In addition , FP ( 500 microg ) inhibited p38 MAPK phosphorylation in primary T cells in vivo at 2 h in samples from two patients ( Figure 7E ) .

Taken together , our data suggest that inhaled FP reduces nuclear localization of <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vivo by acutely inhibiting phospho - <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - importin association .
